result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry A. WAUPOOSE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry A. WAUPOOSE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.

State moves to delete the DVO enhancer on Count 1.  Motion granted.  
Count 1 - Disorderly conduct - Guilty plea.   Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, obstruct officer.   Motion granted.   Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for forty (40) days, under the Huber Law/child care, to commence on 03-20-15 by 5:00 p.m.   Court costs are waived.   
$100.00 cash bail returned to Debra Soch by check instruction No. CR 28.
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.   
Minutes.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 02-20-15 at 3:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 03-06-15 at 10:00 a.m.  Defense counsel asks for the no contact condition of bail to be lifted.  Victim is present and also requests it.  Court amends the condition of bail to no assaultive contact with Leann Behnke.  
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 01-12-15 at 1:30 p.m.  
Notice

At 4:58 p.m. $100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
Notice of address change.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-05-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he provide an address to the Clerk of Court office in writing within 24 hours of release, that he maintain absolute sobriety and have no contact with Leann E. Behnke and her residence at 1222 S. 18th Street, Manitowoc, WI.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
